Files | Macros | Functions
TDA3xx SBL Utilities

Files

file  sbl_utils_tda3xx.h
 This file contains the SBL Utility layer specific to TDA3xx platform. This also contains some related macros, structures and enums.
 

Macros

#define SBL_UTILS_DEVICE_ID_MMC4   ((uint32_t) 0x00000000U)

Function Documentation

int32_t SBLUtilsComputeCRC ( const void *  crcSrcAddr,
uint32_t  crcDataSize,
crcSignature_t *  crcSignVal 
)

This function computes the CRC of the given data.

Parameters
crcSrcAddrSource Address of data for which CRC is calculated.
crcDataSizeCRC Data Size.
crcSignValCRC Signature value.
Returns
status CRC signature calculation status. STW_SOK : Signature is calculated successfully STW_EFAIL : Failed to calculate signature
Note
This API does not initialize and de-initialize the EDMA. This should be taken care by caller.
int32_t SBLUtilsComputeIPUTesocROMCRC ( crcSignature_t *  crcSignVal)

This function computes the CRC of TESOC ROM used for IPU TESOC tests.

Parameters
crcSignValCRC Signature value.
Returns
status CRC signature calculation status. STW_SOK : Signature is calculated successfully STW_EFAIL : Failed to calculate signature
int32_t SBLUtilsConfigDevice ( uint32_t  deviceId)

This function configures the mux for given device.

Parameters
deviceIdDevice to be configured Supported devices for TDA3xx: SBL_UTILS_DEVICE_ID_MMC4 SBL_UTILS_DEVICE_ID_EMAC0PHY SBL_UTILS_DEVICE_ID_UART1 SBL_UTILS_DEVICE_ID_UART2
Returns
status Device Config status. STW_SOK : Device configured successfully STW_EFAIL : Failed to configure device
void SBLUtilsConfigIPU1DefaultAMMU ( void  )

This function does the IPU1's default AMMU Configuration.

Returns
None.
int32_t SBLUtilsConfigureDspEveMux ( uint32_t  oppId,
uint32_t  siliconPackageType 
)

This function configures the source for DSP and EVE clocks based on the package type and opp.

Parameters
oppIdIndex giving the choice of Operating point.
siliconPackageTypeParameter indicates if this is a 15x15 or a 12x12 package.
Returns
status Multiplexer configuration status. STW_SOK : Multiplexer configured successfully STW_EFAIL : Failed to configure multiplexer
void SBLUtilsDisableIPU1AMMU ( void  )

This function disable the AMMU configuration for large pages that was done by SBL.

Returns
None.
void SBLUtilsDisableIPU1Unicache ( void  )

This function disables the IPU1's Uni-cache.

Returns
None.

This function enables the IPU1's Uni-cache.

Returns
None.
void SBLUtilsEvictIPU1Unicache ( void  )

This function evicts the IPU1's Uni-cache.

Returns
None.
void SBLUtilsInvalidateIPU1Unicache ( void  )

This function invalidates the IPU1's Uni-cache.

Returns
None.
void SBLUtilsWakeUpIPU1Core1 ( uint32_t  startAddr)

This function wakes up IPU1 Core1. Core1 is held in WFE by RBL. To wakeup core1 SEV instruction is sent from master core.

Parameters
startAddrAddress at which Core1 starts executing.
Returns
None.
